pull.title: Fix issue #9683 "gui, wallet: random abort (segmentation fault)
pull.body:
Patch taken from @ryanofsky's comment https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/9683#issuecomment-448035913.

[MarcoFalke wrote](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/9683#issuecomment-454066004):
> Mind to submit this patch as a pull request?

So that's what I'm doing.

I was regularly seeing crashes on startup before applying this patch and haven't seen a single crash on startup since applying it almost a month ago.

issue.title: gui, wallet: random abort (segmentation fault) running master/HEAD
issue.body:
I'm running the current master branch version (1c2edd9f). I recently saw it crash shortly after starting up.

    $ ./bitcoin-qt
        *** Error in `./bitcoin-qt': free(): invalid next size (fast): 0x00007f6fabfb5f90 ***
        Aborted

Unfortunately I don't have a stack trace available.

events.body:
utACK ebb0758d14311496e1b1f676c74d5953663e8660. Change should be ok. We never actually narrowed down exactly what was causing the abort to happen or why the change helps, but I have three theories:

1) ~~Missing `setSortRole` call~~ was causing TransactionTableModel::data() to return some unknown field with an inconsistent (non-transitive?) sort order that made Qt crash internally.
2) Not specifying a sort column before calling `setSortingEnabled(true)` was causing a similar problem.
3) Code is still buggy, and this change only masks the problem. Abort is just less likely to happen now because removed `sortByColumn` call means sort only happens once instead of twice in a row.

It would probably be possible to experiment more and narrow down the cause, but I think not necessary. 

Maybe do keep a backup of the crashing wallet around, to help reproduce in case similar bugs happen in the future.

---

EDIT: `setSortRole` call was not actually missing: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15203#discussion_r249168229, so this was probably not the cause.

> keep a backup of the crashing wallet around

It's my main Bitcoin wallet that I've been using since 2011. I'll be keeping it around.

events.body: It would be nice to remove the extra setSortRole call: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15203#discussion_r249168229. But I think it'd be fine to merge this PR with or without that change.
I can do that if you like, but the older hardware I was previously using finally quit working. I'm now on much faster CPU & storage so don't know if I can even reproduce the issue any more.

events.message:
Fix issue #9683 "gui, wallet: random abort (segmentation fault) running master/HEAD".

Patch taken from @ryanofsky's comment
  https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/9683#issuecomment-448035913
and refined according to
  https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15203#discussion_r249168229

events.body: I did a `git reset HEAD^` and `git push --force`. Was that wrong? I don't see the discussion of the previous commit any more unless I click the comment link I put in the commit message.

issue.title: gui: SIGSEGV when starting v0.21.0rc3
issue.body:
**Expected behavior**

No SIGSEGV

**Actual behavior**

SIGSEGV:

    Thread 1 "bitcoin-qt" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
    0x0000555555609470 in GUIUtil::TableViewLastColumnResizingFixer::disconnectViewHeadersSignals (this=0x0) at qt/guiutil.cpp:479
    479	    disconnect(tableView->horizontalHeader(), &QHeaderView::sectionResized, this, &TableViewLastColumnResizingFixer::on_sectionResized);
    (gdb) where
    #0  0x0000555555609470 in GUIUtil::TableViewLastColumnResizingFixer::disconnectViewHeadersSignals (this=0x0) at qt/guiutil.cpp:479
    #1  0x0000555555609860 in GUIUtil::TableViewLastColumnResizingFixer::stretchColumnWidth (this=0x0, column=4) at qt/guiutil.cpp:538
    #2  0x000055555578ce42 in TransactionView::resizeEvent (this=0x555559d7e4f0, event=0x7fffffffb490) at qt/transactionview.cpp:631
    #3  0x00007ffff6fe7ebe in ?? ()
    #4  0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()

**To reproduce**

Unknown. Haven't seen any crashes for over a year, but after building rc3 I got a crash on the first start. I'm running bitcoin-qt.

**System information**

Built from the v0.21.0rc3 tag on Debian with an SSD. Kernel 4.19.0-13-amd64. Debian GNU/Linux 10 (buster). XFCE4, xfwm4.

    $ ldd qt/bitcoin-qt | grep -i qt
        libQt5Core.so.5 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5 (0x00007f7fa9f00000)
        libQt5Gui.so.5 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Gui.so.5 (0x00007f7fa9975000)
        libQt5Widgets.so.5 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Widgets.so.5 (0x00007f7fa931c000)
        libQt5Network.so.5 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Network.so.5 (0x00007f7fa917b000)
        libQt5DBus.so.5 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5DBus.so.5 (0x00007f7fa90e4000)

I ran it again and it worked fine the 2nd time.

comments.body: Note to reviewers: This call is removed to avoid sorting twice in a row. `setSortingEnabled` already sorts the data, and `sortByColumn` would repeat the same sort.

This line is a duplicate of that one:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/9096276e0b2d5b7e19af9a5f3c144ef108ee55e0/src/qt/transactionview.cpp#L225

Confirmed by [Qt docs](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtableview.html#sortingEnabled-prop):
> Setting the property to true with `setSortingEnabled()` immediately triggers a call to `sortByColumn()` with the current sort section and order.

re: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15203#discussion_r249168229

> This line is a duplicate of that one:

Good catch. I think it means this line is not actually doing anything and can be removed.
@ryanofsky why does the default `Qt::DisplayRole` does not work in this case?

re: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15203#discussion_r249168229

> @ryanofsky why does the default Qt::DisplayRole does not work in this case?

I don't know the history of this code or what best practices are in Qt, but it looks like the intention was to use EditRole to sort based on unformatted values, while letting DisplayRole return formatted values:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/63144335becb705a233b32fb8d63f37b7d62071a/src/qt/transactiontablemodel.cpp#L530-L531

> but it looks like the intention was to use EditRole to sort based on unformatted values, while letting DisplayRole return formatted values:

Yep.
